name: Same Parity Summands
description:
You are given two positive integers 
    n
 (
    1 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 10^9
) and

    k
 (
    1 
    ≤ k 
    ≤ 100
). Represent the number 
    n
 as the sum
of 
    k
 positive integers of the same parity (have the same remainder when
divided by 
    2
). In other words, find 
    a_1, a_2, 
    …, a_k
 such
that all 
    a_i>0
, 
    n = a_1 + a_2 + 
    … + a_k
 and either all

    a_i
 are even or all 
    a_i
 are odd at the same time. If such a
representation does not exist, then report it. Input The first line contains
an integer 
    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t 
    ≤ 1000
) — the number of test cases in
the input. Next, 
    t
 test cases are given, one per line. Each test case is
two positive integers 
    n
 (
    1 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 10^9
) and 
    k
 (
    1
    
    ≤ k 
    ≤ 100
). Output For each test case print: YES and the required
values 
    a_i
, if the answer exists (if there are several answers, print
any of them); NO if the answer does not exist. The letters in the words YES
and NO can be printed in any case. Example Input 8 10 3 100 4 8 7 97 2 8 8 3
10 5 3 1000000000 9 Output YES 4 2 4 YES 55 5 5 35 NO NO YES 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 1
NO YES 3 1 1 YES 111111110 111111110 111111110 111111110 111111110 111111110
111111110 111111110 111111120
